Description: Book of the Dead of Nebseny; frame 7. Spell 114; spell 112; spell 113; spell 108.
Production date: 15thC BC (reign of Thutmose IV, by style)
Curator's comments: Published: G. Lapp, The Papyrus of Nebseni (Catalogue of the Books of the Dead in the British Museum 3, 2004). Published: G. Lapp, The Papyrus of Nebseni (Catalogue of the Books of the Dead in the British Museum 3, 2004). For bibliography and date see Irmtraut Munro, Untersuchungen zu den Totenbuch-Papyri der 18.ten Dynastie (London & New York 1987), 281, Katalog, a., 28; the manuscript is Aa in Naville, Tb. Detail of vignette (the Bas of Hermopolis): Stadler, Antike Welt 35/3 (2004): 10, fig.4
Tarasenko, Mykola. 2016. Studies on the vignettes from chapter 17 of the Book of the Dead. I, The image of mś.w Bdšt in ancient Egyptian mythology (Archaeopress Egyptology 16), Oxford, p. 92-93, 99.
Bibliographic references: Munro 1987 / Untersuchungen zu den Totenbuch-Papyri der 18. Dynastie (281)
Taylor 2010 / Journey through the afterlife: Ancient Egyptian Book of the Dead (no. 69)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (134286) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/134286)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2012 July - September, Tokyo, Mori museum, The Book of the Dead: Journey Through the Afterlife 2012, October - November, Fukuoka Museum of Art, The Book of the Dead 2013, May - September, Perth, Western Australian Museum, The Book of the Dead
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: bleached, abraded Black ink Red ink Backed: brown paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: Filmoplast T self adhesive linen tape Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: good (but fragmentary near start and sporadic lacunae)
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Atum (represented in vignette)
Named in inscription & portrayed: Sobek (mentioned in vignette)
Named in inscription & portrayed: Hathor (mentioned in vignette)
Named in inscription & portrayed: Horus (mentioned in vignette)
Named in inscription & portrayed: Imsety (mentioned in vignette)
Named in inscription & portrayed: Qebhsenuef (mentioned in vignette)
Named in inscription & portrayed: Hapy (represented in vignette)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Hermopolis, The ba's of Hermopolis are mentioned and represented in one of the vignettes
